1.0 - SASS Variables

The variable described here are defined in _variable.scss. All variable are global and should be created in this file. Please try to factor out existing code to not duplicate variable content.

To avoid any conflict with third parties SASS variable our variables should be prefixed with bbp-. Before creating a new variable please check that there are not a corresponding Bootstrap variable covering the same useage that exists, most on them will be reproduce in this document but you can look at the official documentation if some are missing.

1.1 - Colors

This is the list of existing color variable as well as what they should be used for. If you add a new variable you should add an entry in this form. Variable containing color information should be prefixed with '''bbp-color-'''.

1.1.1 - Naming

When namming the colors try to use semantic name rather than colors, for example '''warning''' instead of '''yellow''' because a restyling might change the color completly.

You can however use relative color informations like '''light''' or '''darker''' to indicate various version of the same style. If the color targets a specific usage you can use the postfix '''-bg''' for background, '''-border''' for border or '''-text''' for text.

1.2 - Variables

Variable Name Usage
$hbp-common-asset-path Set this path to point to the angular-hbp-common/dist/assets folder.
$hbp-brand-height Set the line-height of the brand and derive the diamond space from this.
$hbp-common-navbar-height Defines the height of the navbar.

1.2.2 - Color List

Variable Name Color Usage
$hbp-header-bg #CCC It's the background color for the portal's header.
$hbp-color-toolbar-bg #DDD Background color for the toolbars.
$hbp-color-toolbar-border #AAA Border color for the toolbars
$hbp-color-border #CCC Generic border color for element that are not toolbars, typically with a background set to $body-bg
$hbp-color-border-dark: #888 Generic darker border when more contrast is needed.
$hbp-color-grey-text #888 Some lighter text, for example when corresponding content is disabled.
$hpb-color-transparent-white: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7) A slightly transparent white.
$hbp-color-highlight: #FFE An highlight color, typically for background that are set to $body-bg when not highlighted.
$hbp-color-highlight-light #F5F5F5 A more subtle highlight color when even less contrast is needed.
$hbp-color-highlight-glow rgba(102, 175, 233, 0.6) A glow color for highlight.
$hbp-color-shadow-dark: rgba(0,0,0,0.6) A very contrasted shadow.
$hbp-color-shadow rgba(0,0,0,0.2) Generic shadow.
$hbp-color-shadow-light rgba(0,0,0,0.1) A light shadow.
$hbp-color-shadow-lighter rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.075) A very sublte shadow.

1.3 - Important Bootstrap Variables

Those variables from Bootstrap should be used every possible time.

1.3.1 - Components

Define common padding and border radius sizes and more. Values based on 14px text and 1.428 line-height (~20px to start). 

$padding-base-vertical:     6px;
$padding-base-horizontal:   12px;

$padding-large-vertical:    10px;
$padding-large-horizontal:  16px;

$padding-small-vertical:    5px;
$padding-small-horizontal:  10px;

$padding-xs-vertical:       1px;
$padding-xs-horizontal:     5px;

$line-height-large:         1.33;
$line-height-small:         1.5;

$border-radius-base:        4px;
$border-radius-large:       6px;
$border-radius-small:       3px;

1.3.2 - Grid

Padding between columns. Gets divided in half for the left and right. 

$grid-gutter-width:         30px;

1.3.3 - Bootstrap Color Variables

Since we use sass bootstrap we inherit from thier variables. Amongst them are a few that define color. Here is a list of them followed by their custom value if we modifed them (see: Bootstrap's documentation).

Variable Name Color Usage Customized Value
$gray-darker lighten(#000, 13.5%)
$gray-dark lighten(#000, 20%) $text-color
$gray lighten(#000, 33.5%)
$gray-light lighten(#000, 60%)
$gray-lighter lighten(#000, 93.5%)
$brand-primary #428bca $link-color
$brand-success #5cb85c
$brand-info #5bc0de
$brand-warning #f0ad4e
$brand-danger #d9534f
$body-bg #fff
$link-hover-color darken($link-color, 15%)
